title-group.article-title: Metaphor and Metamorphosis in Shelley's "The Witch of Atlas"

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1980 The Trustees of Boston University

Jerome McGann explores this duplicity in "Shelley's Veils: A Thousand Images of Loveliness," in W. Paul Elledge and Richard L. Hoffman, eds., Romantic and Victorian (Cranbury, N.J.: Fairleigh Dickenson U. Press, 1971), pp. 198-218.
McGann falls back on "the soul's highest intuitions" as origins that are clouded only later by metaphor (p. 200).
